org.easylibs.options.util

Class OptionsRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.easylibs.options.util.OptionsRegistry

  • public class OptionsRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    A registry for TypeMapper and error handlers. TypeMapper mappings are used to parse and map command line arguments to java types.
    See Also:
    register(java.lang.Class<T>, org.easylibs.options.util.TypeMapper<T>)

      • getOrElseAutoCreate

        public <T> TypeMapper<T> getOrElseAutoCreate(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                             java.util.Optional<java.lang.Class<?>> genericType)

        If no mapper is defined for a type, this method will try one of its many algorithms to come up with a mapper that will work with the requested type. For example, all collection, array and enum types are automatically created, if no user defined custom mapping exists. Mappings are done recursively.

        For example if we have a Collection<Integer>, then one mapping for Collection is created is created and another mapping for Integer. The mapping is cached as a concrete-generic pair. So a mapping of Collection<Float> will be different from Collection<Integer>.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:
        type - the type
        genericType - if the mapper type is generic, the generic type must be provided
        Returns:
        the or else auto create
